title: rustc can't find function-style #[proc_macro] in extern crate.
body:
I'm experimenting with `proc_macro` as an expression and run into rustc complaining that it can't find the macro when I follow it's advice on how to use the macro.

I have a `proc-macro` crate that contains the following function in `src/lib/rs`:
```rust
#[proc_macro]
pub fn signal(input: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { ... }
```
And an example that uses the macro:

```rust
#![feature(proc_macro_non_items)]

#[macro_use]
extern crate cedar_apple_codegen;

fn main() {
    let s = signal!(8);
}
```

This results in the following message:

```
   Compiling cedar-apple-codegen v0.1.0 (file:///Users/djg/Dropbox/cedar-apple-rs/cedar-apple-codegen)
error: procedural macros cannot be imported with `#[macro_use]`
  --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:57:13
   |
57 |     let s = signal!(8);
   |             ^^^^^^
help: instead, import the procedural macro like any other item
   |
9  | use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;
   |
```

Adding `use cedar_apple_codegen::signal` results in:

```
   Compiling cedar-apple-codegen v0.1.0 (file:///Users/djg/Dropbox/cedar-apple-rs/cedar-apple-codegen)
error[E0432]: unresolved import `cedar_apple_codegen::signal`
 --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:6:5
  |
6 | use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ no `signal` in the root

error: procedural macros cannot be imported with `#[macro_use]`
  --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:57:13
   |
6  | use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;
   | - help: instead, import the procedural macro like any other item: `use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;`
...
57 |     let s = signal!(8);
   |             ^^^^^^

warning: unused import: `cedar_apple_codegen::signal`
 --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:6:5
  |
6 | use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default
```

Removing `#[macro_use]` from `extern crate cedar_apple_codegen` results in:

```
   Compiling cedar-apple-codegen v0.1.0 (file:///Users/djg/Dropbox/cedar-apple-rs/cedar-apple-codegen)
warning: proc macro crates and `#[no_link]` crates have no effect without `#[macro_use]`
 --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:4:1
  |
4 | extern crate cedar_apple_codegen;
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0432]: unresolved import `cedar_apple_codegen::signal`
 --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:6:5
  |
6 | use cedar_apple_codegen::signal;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ no `signal` in the root

error: cannot find macro `signal!` in this scope
  --> cedar-apple-codegen/examples/signal.rs:57:13
   |
57 |     let s = signal!(8);
   |             ^^^^^^
```

I'm using the following `nightly` compiler:

```
rustc 1.29.0-nightly (31f1bc7b4 2018-07-15)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 31f1bc7b40469b9319f1ba610ad8760ebd11c3da
commit-date: 2018-07-15
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.29.0-nightly
LLVM version: 7.0
```
